author: Republic_Commando_Sev

review:
I LOVE Jaller! I love how the lego company decided to use oarnge and red together! The crab is awesome! It can hold a cordak blaster. I also like the sword although it's only 1 sided! His mask is awesome! Probably one of the best looking masks ever!
Republic Commando Sev

author: reidak49
title: great set :)
review: nice i like the crab it has the cordak blaster on its back and is simple to build but the cordak blaster is hard to fire but the chain is cool and jaller is great the sword is nice and nice mask and air hoses fit the under water theme over all cool

author: dy_enforcer
title: The Leader of the Toa Mahri
review:
Jaller has some nice parts and he is very fun to pose.His mask and his sword are the best thing I have ever seen.His pet Hahnah crab really suits him and Cordak Blaster really fires,Just press hard enough and it will fly off.What I really like about the set is the new parts such as Jaller's chest armour(Also use for a crab)and his mask called Kanohi Arthron.Jaller's Mahri form is the same as the Inika form except his Energized Flame Sword changed into a Power Sword,His Inika head turned back into a Metru head which is a good thing cause I really don't like the Inika head that much and the transparent orange ball joint pieces are replaced by the regular ones.At first,Jaller's toa mahri design is like a diver because of the tubes,but,its not because if he is a diver,he should have a air gas tank in his back.His tubes represent as gills for breathing underwater.So,here are the Pros and Cons.

Pros:

-Fun to pose
-Color scheme is great
-His pet Hahnah crab suits him well
-Cordak Blaster can really fire if you press it hard
-New pieces such as Jaller's chest armour or a crab body

Cons:

-No more light up swords

Overall: 5(9/10)A great set for bionicle fans out there.So buy it right now before its sold out.

author: Gus_263
title: Fire in the deep
review: The sword is great, the mask cool, the crab a feature, but it too have cons:  The black hands and others pieces are black, and the cordak is heavy. Sometimes it launchs easily, sometimes hard. The armor looks like  the mask, and it isn't great without another armor. He have also a chain.

author: DarthVader_
title: Awesome Set!
review: This is one of my favorite Bionicles!  It basicly IS my favorite Bionicle!  I like the sword and the Hanah crab!  I like how the chain conects the two together!  I really like the mask!  It is an awesome set!

author: Jim_Java
title: No, That's Not His Foot...
review:
First of all, I would just like to let anyone confused by the picture know that Jaller does not have a crab for a foot.  The crab is attached to Jaller's Cordak blaster, which is chained to Jaller.  I am not sure what the benefits are to having an undersea creature carry your gun for you, but since this feature can be easily corrected, I won't complain.
Mahri (Is it supposed to sound like "Marie?") Jaller is pretty neat. He bears little resemblence to Inika Jaller, aside from the cool  red-and-orange coloring, but this is not neccasarily a bad thing, since Inika Jaller had one of the (how do I put this?) less-threatening masks to come along in BIONICLE.  
Obviously, he's a pretty simple build, basically copying the Inika in structure, but thanks to the crab, he can be modified quite a bit.  At present, mine has a shoulder-mounted Cordak blaster, a lavaboard similar to Tahu Nuva's, and a crab fused to his chest.  He also has had the breathing tubes taken off his mask, and inserted elsewhere. The tubes are cool-looking, but complicate taking the mask off when inserted into it.  
The negative aspects of this figure are pretty small, and basically amount to it ripping off the Inika, and not coming in an actual canister. Yes, Jaller and all other Inika come in a plastic frame with cardboard on the back. Once the cardboard is removed, the plastic is basically useless for storage, although technic pins can inserted into it.  A shame, since the back is one of the better ones in a while.
Overall, Jaller is a pretty good figure. I would say to get him if it you want one of the Mahri, and you aren't interested in what they do in the stories. (Becuase then, Matoro takes the cake.)

author: legoguy_3000_

review:
This is a great set but out of all the toa mahri this one is my second favrorite.

pros:

cordak blaster really fires

cons:
nothing

I think this set is really cool 4/5

author: BionicleBOOM
title: Way better than 2006
review:
Boy, now that I have four of the six Toa Mahri, and brother has the other two, it's hard to decide who you like most, but I still like Hahli the best.  But Jaller, with his Hannah crab and all, is pretty neat.  Way better than his previous form.  I like how they used the same piece for the crab as they did for Jaller's breast plate.  Overall, there's nothing really remarkable about him, but somehow you are able to like him.  A lot.

Pros:

-Crab w/ Cordak blaster

-Two (2) Mahri tubes

-New sword

-Better than '06 form (THAT goes for something)

Cons:

-They used a LEGO System chain

Overall 5.5/5.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Toa Mahri) - Toa Jaller Review
review:
This is a great figure to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Parts

This set has 68 pieces and it was 10 USD when it was on sale. That means that the price per piece ratio was 15 cents per piece which is a really good value for what we get here.

The build

The build is very nice and easy and we also don't need to complain about stickers.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8911-1.jpg[/img]


The arms, the hands, the legs, the feet and the head can be adjusted. On one hand we can see a cool looking sword and on the other hand we get a chain which is holding a crab. On the back of the crab is a turret which you can sviwel. The only two things which I don't like about this set is that the turret doesn't really work and that the box can be messed up very easily if you want to open it.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de


Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

author: NickBrick
title: Machine gun!
review:
This was my first Bionicle, and a pretty cool one at that. The toa mahri were some the main sets that got me back into Lego. I wanted something reallistic. Something with a sword, plain, and simple. So I got Jaller. Jaller is very pose-able. The rahi that comes with him though has one major problem. Its eyes don't fit in the sockets! Jaller's mask is very good.

And the tubes make it look like he has a breathing mask. Now, is there anything I missed. Oh yeah! The Cordak blaster is great and fires six rubber pellets. It confused me at first that you had to really slam down on back of the blaster to make it fire.

A very good Bionicle indeed. However. I feel I should warn you that the quallity of the plastic
has been bad since 2006. And now my copy of Jaller has had his arms broken off. and his legs are cracked.

author: PaulTR
title: Possibly the Best Toa EVER!
review:
When I saw Jaller in the LEGO Shop at Home catalogue, I was really excited. However, as fascinated with him as I was, I had some questions: Was he sturdy? Did those tubes limit movement? And what's with that Cordak-weilding crab thingy? Thankfully, Jaller has exceeded my expectations beyond belief, and I think he is one of the best Toa sets ever!

 

First off, Jaller looks amazing. His orange, red, and black color scheme is perfect, and hearken back images of the good old days of the Toa Nuva and Metru Nui. This is compounded by the fact that his awesome lava sword looks like a mash-up of Toa Lihkan's great swords, and Toa Tahu's beastly twin fire blades. Jaller's armor is also really unique and cool looking, and while it's not as flashy as his Inika armor, it looks just as good. I also really like his mask; in my opinion, Jaller's previous Inika mask was the black, ugly sheep of the Inika lineup. However, this new mask looks ten times better, and I think has to be near the top ten coolest Toa masks of all time. The only con with his looks that I can think of is some people say his chest sticks out a little too much. However, I just can't see that it does, no matter how hard I look. And trust me, I would spot a thing like that immediately, as I'm pretty obsessive about reviewing my Bionicles. Now, its bonus time: Jaller's Hannah crab also looks fantastic, and looks just like a crab should: feisty, angry, and armed with some nice claws. So, in the looks department, Jaller is a front-runner in the "Coolest, Most Retro Looking Toa" beauty pageant, if there is such a thing.

 

Jaller was also a great and fun build. His body is made like a standard Inika or Piraka build except one thing: his chest armor is cleverly attached to his body through the use of black axel pieces, and his mask tubes wrap around to his chest. Combine this with his VERY cleverly designed crab, Jaller is probably one of the better canister set builds I've seen for a while. Jaller also includes some really great pieces: plenty of orange and red legs and arms, a cool weapon, 2 chest/crab pieces, a new mask, and some useful tube pieces. Its a great blend, and I think MOCers will be very pleased. Overall, Jaller's pieces are fantastic, though I must admit there are some other sets with more unique pieces (Hahli's wings are a good example). But this slight downside is blown away by the fact that Jaller has more pieces, 68 in fact, than any of the other Mahri. Yay!

 

Jaller is tons of fun to play with as well. You can swing his sword, shoot his Cordak blaster, and have his crab jump on Barraki ("Whoa, dude, get off! We're, like, the same species!"-Carapar). I think Jaller's fire sword is amazing, and you can use it to put the hurtin' on the Barraki with back-handed swipes, or flat out lunges. And if you're skeptical of a Toa of Fire having a little crab haul his Cordak blaster around, you can just take off the chain, and use the post/axel piece to attach the blaster to his hand like the other Mahri. Sweet! And as far as those restrictive-looking tubes look, not too fret; they don't limit movement very much, and they aren't as tight as Hahli's. However, while Jaller is very fun to play with, there are some issues with Jaller's playability. First, the Cordak blaster, while fun, is a little hard to shoot. Thankfully, it's not as bad as the wretched squid launchers. In fact, Jaller has a slight advantage over his fellow Mahri: since his bulky Cordak blaster is on a crab and not tucked close to his body, its much easier to hold and shoot. As another con, however, Jaller does not include any action features like gears or extra points of articulation. Boo. But Jaller completely redeems himself in the poseability field! You can make him glower at his enemies, strike an agressive pose with his sword, and look victorious as he recovers the Mask of Life (I actually don't have the mask of Life piece, so I use Dekar's mask instead;) All in all, Jaller is a really poseble guy, and along with his crab you can make some really neat poses. And, he looks amazing next to his fellow Mahri, especially Hahli. But enough of my talking! Let me stack up the facts for you:

 

Pros:

  • -Looks absolutely stupendous (so does the crab!)
  • -Fun and unique build
  • -Useful and cool pieces, like his fire sword
  • -Sturdy and fun to play with
  • -More pieces than the other Mahri
  • -Includes a Hannah crab
  • -Fun to pose

Cons:

  • -Cordak blaster a little tricky to fire
  • -Not as many "Whoa! Check this out!" pieces as the other Mahri
  • -No gears
  • -Head a little restricted in movement

Well, should you get Jaller? Uhhh, could I make a more rehtorical question!? BUY HIM NOW! He is the best of the Toa Mahri, and quite possibly one of the best Toa ever created. Even if you only get one Toa Mahri, Jaller is the guy you should pick. And if you want to try to buy all of the Mahri, than he's a no-brainer. In my estimation, he's the best $10 US dollars I spent on Bionicle (Besides Hydraxon :) So, hit the internet and get Jaller! Trust me, you won't regret it!

author: LEGOFREAK01
title: "I found the mask!"
review:
Greetings Lego fans! I am here to review 8911 Toa Jaller. First i'd like to say that jaller, unlike the movie, does NOT have rib-cage protectors... But I found out that you can actually get his hahnah crab's feet and add them on at his waist where his "lower armor" is. anyway, Jaller is one of the best toa of all! not only is his mask one of the coolest, it's also the "Kanohi arthon." the mask of sonar. he also has an awesome "aquatic power blade" along with this SPECIAL feature: this set comes with one extra red rod so you can put the cordak blaster on his hand! he also has a new type of armor with a VERY unique build. The pieces are also great for MOCing! anyway, enough chit-chat, onto the pros-cons! 

Pros

  • -GREAT mask!
  • -(like all the other mahri,) Cordak blaster!
  • -pieces are great for MOCing!
  • -hahnah crab!
  • -extra piece for placing the cordak blaster on Jaller's hand!
  • -armor is very... Interesting...
  • -unique build.
  • -WAY better than the inika form.

Cons

  • -armor...Kinda sticks out a little, not too much of a prob.
  • -tubes may (sometimes) limit pose-ability.
  • -some people may like the inika version better.

if you do not have any other mahri, i'd recommend this set as your first. of course, seeing it's 2011 (or when your reading this it MIGHT be 2012-2013) it's not so easy to buy him off amazon or ebay but like i said: I do recommend this set as your first. I hope my review was helpful! -LEGOFREAK01

review:
I got this set many years ago for myself, and think that this is an excellent little set for the 2007 collection.

Cons

This is an excellent set, one which is a great Bionicle starter. I highly recommend this set to all Bionicle lovers.

author: CaptainBrick33
title: The best BIONICLE "canister" set!
review:
After writing some reviews of Ninjago sets, this is my first Bionicle set review. But why am I reviewing Toa Mahri Jaller first? Well, it's simple. In my opinion, Jaller Mahri is the best Bionicle canister set released. Here is why:

Packaging

The Toa Mahri were the first Bionicle "canister sets" not to be released in a canister. Ironic, huh? Like his brothers (and sister), Jaller was packaged in a cardboard packaging with a plastic cover. Unfortunately, I have bought this set used and it did not come with the "box". 

Instructions and building experience

The Instructions are fairly standard for a set like this. The building experience is also pretty straight-forward. After building the Toa Inika, you can construct Jaller Mahri without using the instructions. At least there is a minor amount of complexity in the tube and armour placement. 

Parts

As with all Bionicle canister sets, there are some interesting parts included. For parts, which were new at the time of this set's release, we have Jaller's mask (the Kanohi Arthron), Jaller's aquatic power blade, the Cordak Blaster, the silver tube, the lower torso armour and upper torso armour, which is also used for the Hahnah crab's body. However, the only exclusive piece is the blended red-and-orange Arthron. There are no recolours. 

Build

Since there are no minifigures in Bionicle sets, let's look at the two models, starting with Takua's best friend, Toa Jaller.

Out of all the Toa Mahri, Jaller has arguably changed the least compared to his Inika form. His legs and arms are identical, though the transparent orange has been swapped with normal orange. His body is a bit different though, as it uses a new armour piece. However, because of how wide it is, it limits arm movement greatly. Underneath his mask, he has a standard Toa Metru head with greenish eyes, matching his previous version. There are also some tubes, which connect to the mask and to the torso armour, which surprisingly don't restrict head articulation. On Jaller's back there are three holes, in which you can put three spare Cordak rockets. He wields his aquatic power blade in one hand, and a chain to guide his crab friend in the other.

Jaller Mahri is actually the only Toa set to include a Rahi side build (I'm not counting Toa Lhikan!). The Rahi here is called a Hahnah, which are crab-like animals that lived in Mahri Nui. The crab is built using Jaller's upper torso armour, a pair of silver Piruk claws and some pieces from the Barraki (eyes, teeth, etc.). I think the Hahnah looks great for the small number of parts it uses, and it's a great companion to Jaller. It holds a Cordak Blaster on it's back, which I'll get into in the playability section. 

Playability

The only play function in this set is the Cordak Blaster, which is attached to the Hahnah's back, though it can be held by Jaller using an axle rod. It can shoot six missiles at a time, but I've often had some trouble firing them. Sometimes they shoot out really well, and other times they don't. And from what I've heard, other people have the same issue as well. 

Because Jaller Mahri is a standard Inika build, he has all the normal points of articulation. In total, there are 13 points of movement on Jaller, and 3 on the crab.

Conclusion

So, is this set any good? Let's recap:

Pros

  • Lots of new pieces
  • Nice looking sword and mask
  • Rahi companion
  • Good articulation
  • Blended pieces!
  • Good amount of pieces for the price (68 in total)

Cons

  • Armour restricts arm movement
  • Cordak Blaster doesn't work well
  • Standard Inika build

In conclusion, Toa Jaller Mahri is an excellent set. It has possibly the best value out of any medium-sized Bionicle set, with it including two substantial builds, some great pieces, and an overall very solid design. While the main play function of this set, the Cordak Blaster, isn't the greatest, the pros definitely overcome the cons.  

Should you get this set? Absolutely!
